title: What you need to know about Foot-and-Mouth Disease.

tasks.task: Understand and communicate about Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD)
subtasks: Identify the contagious nature of FMD
Recognize affected animals (cows, sheep, goats, pigs, etc.)
Describe the signs of FMD in different animals (cattle, pigs, sheep/goats)
Explain transmission methods of FMD (direct contact, contaminated materials, clothing/equipment, meat products)
Follow protocol upon suspecting FMD (notify veterinarian, limit animal/人员 movement)
Appreciate the importance of reporting FMD to prevent spread
Comply with measures to contain FMD if confirmed

tasks.task: Prevent the spread of Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD)
subtasks: Maintain cleanliness of clothing and equipment when near infected areas
Disinfect vehicles and facilities that come into contact with infected animals
Avoid moving animals to or from infected farms
Educate others on the importance of reporting FMD suspicions
Cooperate with local authorities in containment efforts

tasks.task: Created by analyzing the transcript for physical tasks related to agriculture, specifically focusing on Foot and Mouth Disease. Transcribed steps include recognizing disease signs, transmission methods, and containment actions. Tasks involve communication, identification, and preventive measures important for farm management and public health. Tasks are grouped into understanding FMD and preventing its spread. Final answer structured MAINTASK with subtasks as per the transcript's key points.
subtasks: MAINTASK: Understand and communicate about Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD); SUBTASK: Identify the contagious nature of FMD; SUBTASK: Recognize affected animals (cows, sheep, goats, pigs, etc.); SUBTASK: Describe the signs of FMD in different animals (cattle, pigs, sheep/goats); SUBTASK: Explain transmission methods of FMD (direct contact, contaminated materials, clothing/equipment, meat products); SUBTASK: Follow protocol upon suspecting FMD (notify veterinarian, limit animal/人员 movement); SUBTASK: Appreciate the importance of reporting FMD to prevent spread; SUBTASK: Comply with measures to contain FMD if confirmed; MAINTASK: Prevent the spread of Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD); SUBTASK: Maintain cleanliness of clothing and equipment when near infected areas; SUBTASK: Disinfect vehicles and facilities that come into contact with infected animals; SUBTASK: Avoid moving animals to or from infected farms; SUBTASK: Educate others on the importance of reporting FMD suspicions; SUBTASK: Cooperate with local authorities in containment efforts.
